trans-unit.source: Create an Attachment
trans-unit.target: Create an Attachment

trans-unit.source: There are two ways to create an attachment resource – post the media content to DocumentDB like in the <externalLink><linkText>AtomPub Protocol</linkText><linkUri>https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc5023</linkUri></externalLink>, or post just the attachment metadata to media stored externally.
trans-unit.target: There are two ways to create an attachment resource – post the media content to DocumentDB like in the <externalLink><linkText>AtomPub Protocol</linkText><linkUri>https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc5023</linkUri></externalLink>, or post just the attachment metadata to media stored externally.

trans-unit.source: The first is to POST the raw media in the body payload to store it in the provided attachment storage under your DocumentDB account.
trans-unit.target: The first is to POST the raw media in the body payload to store it in the provided attachment storage under your DocumentDB account.

trans-unit.source: For the attachment storage quota, see <externalLink><linkText>DocumentDB limits</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/documentdb-limits/</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: For the attachment storage quota, see <externalLink><linkText>DocumentDB limits</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/documentdb-limits/</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: To create this type of attachment, developers include the raw attachment (video, audio, file, blob, etc.)
trans-unit.target: To create this type of attachment, developers include the raw attachment (video, audio, file, blob, etc.)

trans-unit.source: as the body of the POST.
trans-unit.target: as the body of the POST.

trans-unit.source: Two headers must be set: <legacyBold>Content-Type</legacyBold> and <legacyBold>Slug</legacyBold>.
trans-unit.target: Two headers must be set: <legacyBold>Content-Type</legacyBold> and <legacyBold>Slug</legacyBold>.

trans-unit.source: The <legacyBold>Content-Type</legacyBold> header is set to the MIME type of the attachment while the <legacyBold>Slug</legacyBold> header is set to the name of the attachment.
trans-unit.target: The <legacyBold>Content-Type</legacyBold> header is set to the MIME type of the attachment while the <legacyBold>Slug</legacyBold> header is set to the name of the attachment.

trans-unit.source: The second way to create an attachment resource is to POST the attachment resource properties noting the type and media link of the attachment.
trans-unit.target: The second way to create an attachment resource is to POST the attachment resource properties noting the type and media link of the attachment.

trans-unit.source: Unlike the first type of attachment resource, the <legacyBold>Content-Type</legacyBold> and <legacyBold>Slug</legacyBold> headers are not to be set as the raw media is not part of the request payload.
trans-unit.target: Unlike the first type of attachment resource, the <legacyBold>Content-Type</legacyBold> and <legacyBold>Slug</legacyBold> headers are not to be set as the raw media is not part of the request payload.

trans-unit.source: Request
trans-unit.target: Request

trans-unit.source: Request Syntax
trans-unit.target: Request Syntax

trans-unit.source: Method
trans-unit.target: Method

trans-unit.source: Request URI
trans-unit.target: Request URI

trans-unit.source: HTTP Version
trans-unit.target: HTTP Version

trans-unit.source: POST
trans-unit.target: POST

trans-unit.source: https://{databaseaccount}.documents.azure.com/dbs/{_rid-db}/colls/{_rid-col}/docs/{_rid-doc}/attachments.
trans-unit.target: https://{databaseaccount}.documents.azure.com/dbs/{_rid-db}/colls/{_rid-col}/docs/{_rid-doc}/attachments.

trans-unit.source: HTTP/1.1
trans-unit.target: HTTP/1.1

trans-unit.source: Note that the {databaseaccount} is the name of the DocumentDB account created under your subscription.
trans-unit.target: Note that the {databaseaccount} is the name of the DocumentDB account created under your subscription.

trans-unit.source: The {_rid-db} value is the resource ID of the database.
trans-unit.target: The {_rid-db} value is the resource ID of the database.

trans-unit.source: The {_rid-col} value is the resource ID of the collection the document is contained in.
trans-unit.target: The {_rid-col} value is the resource ID of the collection the document is contained in.

trans-unit.source: The {_rid-doc} value is the document associated with the attachment.
trans-unit.target: The {_rid-doc} value is the document associated with the attachment.

trans-unit.source: Request Headers
trans-unit.target: Request Headers

trans-unit.source: Standard Header
trans-unit.target: Standard Header

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Authorization
trans-unit.target: Authorization

trans-unit.source: <legacyBold>Required</legacyBold>.
trans-unit.target: <legacyBold>Required</legacyBold>.

trans-unit.source: The authentication type and signature token.
trans-unit.target: The authentication type and signature token.

trans-unit.source: Only the master key token is allowed for this operation.
trans-unit.target: Only the master key token is allowed for this operation.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <legacyLink xlink:href="c3c3324c-9a3f-4cad-8a74-bd73d8b4e40b" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Access Control on DocumentDB Resources</legacyLink>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <legacyLink xlink:href="c3c3324c-9a3f-4cad-8a74-bd73d8b4e40b" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Access Control on DocumentDB Resources</legacyLink>.

trans-unit.source: Content-Type
trans-unit.target: Content-Type

trans-unit.source: <legacyBold>Optional</legacyBold>.
trans-unit.target: <legacyBold>Optional</legacyBold>.

trans-unit.source: The content type of the attachment.
trans-unit.target: The content type of the attachment.

trans-unit.source: This is only required when raw media is submitted to the DocumentDB attachment storage.
trans-unit.target: This is only required when raw media is submitted to the DocumentDB attachment storage.

trans-unit.source: For more details, refer to <externalLink><linkText>AtomPub Protocol</linkText><linkUri>https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc5023</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: For more details, refer to <externalLink><linkText>AtomPub Protocol</linkText><linkUri>https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc5023</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: Slug
trans-unit.target: Slug

trans-unit.source: <legacyBold>Optional</legacyBold>.
trans-unit.target: <legacyBold>Optional</legacyBold>.

trans-unit.source: The name of the attachment.
trans-unit.target: The name of the attachment.

trans-unit.source: This is only required when raw media is submitted to the DocumentDB attachment storage.
trans-unit.target: This is only required when raw media is submitted to the DocumentDB attachment storage.

trans-unit.source: For more details, refer to <externalLink><linkText>AtomPub Protocol</linkText><linkUri>https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc5023</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: For more details, refer to <externalLink><linkText>AtomPub Protocol</linkText><linkUri>https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc5023</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: User-Agent
trans-unit.target: User-Agent

trans-unit.source: <legacyBold>Optional</legacyBold>.
trans-unit.target: <legacyBold>Optional</legacyBold>.

trans-unit.source: The client user agent performing the request.
trans-unit.target: The client user agent performing the request.

trans-unit.source: The recommended format is {user agent name}/{version}.
trans-unit.target: The recommended format is {user agent name}/{version}.

trans-unit.source: For example, the DocumentDB .NET SDK sets the <legacyBold>User-Agent</legacyBold> string to <token>azure_doccli_ver</token>.
trans-unit.target: For example, the DocumentDB .NET SDK sets the <legacyBold>User-Agent</legacyBold> string to <token>azure_doccli_ver</token>.

trans-unit.source: Custom Header
trans-unit.target: Custom Header

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: x-ms-date
trans-unit.target: x-ms-date

trans-unit.source: <legacyBold>Required</legacyBold>.
trans-unit.target: <legacyBold>Required</legacyBold>.

trans-unit.source: The date of the request, per RFC 1123.
trans-unit.target: The date of the request, per RFC 1123.

trans-unit.source: The date is expressed in Coordinated Universal Time format, e.g. Fri, 08 Apr 2015 03:52:31 GMT.
trans-unit.target: The date is expressed in Coordinated Universal Time format, e.g. Fri, 08 Apr 2015 03:52:31 GMT.

trans-unit.source: x-ms-version
trans-unit.target: x-ms-version

trans-unit.source: <legacyBold>Optional</legacyBold>.
trans-unit.target: <legacyBold>Optional</legacyBold>.

trans-unit.source: The version of the DocumentDB REST service.
trans-unit.target: The version of the DocumentDB REST service.

trans-unit.source: The latest version is used when the header is not provided.
trans-unit.target: The latest version is used when the header is not provided.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <legacyLink xlink:href="f174cfcb-644c-4006-a5e9-2ad30c39b38a" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Versioning for DocumentDB REST API</legacyLink>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <legacyLink xlink:href="f174cfcb-644c-4006-a5e9-2ad30c39b38a" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Versioning for DocumentDB REST API</legacyLink>.

trans-unit.source: x-ms-indexing-directive
trans-unit.target: x-ms-indexing-directive

trans-unit.source: <legacyBold>Optional</legacyBold>.
trans-unit.target: <legacyBold>Optional</legacyBold>.

trans-unit.source: The acceptable value is <parameterReference>Include</parameterReference> or <parameterReference>Exclude</parameterReference>.
trans-unit.target: The acceptable value is <parameterReference>Include</parameterReference> or <parameterReference>Exclude</parameterReference>.

trans-unit.source: <parameterReference>Include</parameterReference> includes the attachment from indexing
trans-unit.target: <parameterReference>Include</parameterReference> includes the attachment from indexing

trans-unit.source: <parameterReference>Exclude</parameterReference> omits the document from indexing.
trans-unit.target: <parameterReference>Exclude</parameterReference> omits the document from indexing.

trans-unit.source: Raw media or attachment bits are not indexed or searchable.
trans-unit.target: Raw media or attachment bits are not indexed or searchable.

trans-unit.source: Request Body
trans-unit.target: Request Body

trans-unit.source: Property
trans-unit.target: Property

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: id
trans-unit.target: id

trans-unit.source: <legacyBold>Not Required to be set when attaching raw media</legacyBold>.
trans-unit.target: <legacyBold>Not Required to be set when attaching raw media</legacyBold>.

trans-unit.source: This is a user settable property.
trans-unit.target: This is a user settable property.

trans-unit.source: It is the unique name that identifies the attachment, i.e. no two attachments will share the same <legacyBold>id</legacyBold>.
trans-unit.target: It is the unique name that identifies the attachment, i.e. no two attachments will share the same <legacyBold>id</legacyBold>.

trans-unit.source: The <legacyBold>id</legacyBold> must not exceed 255 characters.
trans-unit.target: The <legacyBold>id</legacyBold> must not exceed 255 characters.

trans-unit.source: contentType
trans-unit.target: contentType

trans-unit.source: <legacyBold>Not Required to be set when attaching raw media</legacyBold>.
trans-unit.target: <legacyBold>Not Required to be set when attaching raw media</legacyBold>.

trans-unit.source: This is a user settable property.
trans-unit.target: This is a user settable property.

trans-unit.source: It notes the content type of the attachment.
trans-unit.target: It notes the content type of the attachment.

trans-unit.source: When submitting the attachment bits as body, DocumentDB sets the <legacyBold>contentType</legacyBold> to the type set in the <legacyBold>Content-Type</legacyBold> header.
trans-unit.target: When submitting the attachment bits as body, DocumentDB sets the <legacyBold>contentType</legacyBold> to the type set in the <legacyBold>Content-Type</legacyBold> header.

trans-unit.source: Media
trans-unit.target: Media

trans-unit.source: <legacyBold>Not Required to be set when attaching raw media</legacyBold>.
trans-unit.target: <legacyBold>Not Required to be set when attaching raw media</legacyBold>.

trans-unit.source: This is the URL link or file path where the attachment resides.
trans-unit.target: This is the URL link or file path where the attachment resides.

trans-unit.source: Request Example(s)
trans-unit.target: Request Example(s)

trans-unit.source: Sample Request: Attachment with Raw Media
trans-unit.target: Sample Request: Attachment with Raw Media

trans-unit.source: This sample shows that the raw media submitted is part of the POST payload.
trans-unit.target: This sample shows that the raw media submitted is part of the POST payload.

trans-unit.source: The <legacyBold>Content-Type</legacyBold> header is set to image/png and the <legacyBold>Slug</legacyBold> header to brush.png.
trans-unit.target: The <legacyBold>Content-Type</legacyBold> header is set to image/png and the <legacyBold>Slug</legacyBold> header to brush.png.

trans-unit.source: Sample Request: Attachment without Raw Media (only metadata)
trans-unit.target: Sample Request: Attachment without Raw Media (only metadata)

trans-unit.source: This sample shows the JSON body containing the metadata of the attachment resource, and specifies the name, type and link for the raw media.
trans-unit.target: This sample shows the JSON body containing the metadata of the attachment resource, and specifies the name, type and link for the raw media.

trans-unit.source: Note that the <legacyBold>Content-Type</legacyBold> and <legacyBold>Slug</legacyBold> headers are not set.
trans-unit.target: Note that the <legacyBold>Content-Type</legacyBold> and <legacyBold>Slug</legacyBold> headers are not set.

trans-unit.target: The <legacyBold>Content-Type</legacyBold> is application/json.

trans-unit.target: DocumentDB always return the response body in standard JSON format.

trans-unit.target: etag

trans-unit.source: This etag carries the same value as the _etag value returned as part of the response body.
trans-unit.target: This etag carries the same value as the _etag value returned as part of the response body.

trans-unit.target: This date time format conforms to the RFC 1123 date time format expressed in Coordinated Universal Time.

trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: x-ms-max-media-storage-usage-mb
trans-unit.target: x-ms-max-media-storage-usage-mb

trans-unit.source: When using DocumentDB attachment storage to store raw media, this header shows the total allotted attachment storage quota for the account.
trans-unit.target: When using DocumentDB attachment storage to store raw media, this header shows the total allotted attachment storage quota for the account.

trans-unit.source: For more information on limits and quotas, see <externalLink><linkText>DocumentDB limits</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/documentdb-limits/</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: For more information on limits and quotas, see <externalLink><linkText>DocumentDB limits</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/documentdb-limits/</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: x-ms-media-storage-usage-mb
trans-unit.target: x-ms-media-storage-usage-mb

trans-unit.source: When using DocumentDB attachment storage to store raw media, this header shows the current attachment storage consumed.
trans-unit.target: When using DocumentDB attachment storage to store raw media, this header shows the current attachment storage consumed.

trans-unit.source: x-ms-request-charge
trans-unit.target: x-ms-request-charge

trans-unit.target: This is The number of request units (RU) consumed by the operation.

trans-unit.source: For more information about request units, see <externalLink><linkText>Manage DocumentDB capacity and performance</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/documentdb-manage/</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.target: It is used for trouble-shooting purposes.

trans-unit.target: This is the URL link or file path where the attachment resides.

trans-unit.source: _rid
trans-unit.target: _rid

trans-unit.source: This is a system generated property.
trans-unit.target: This is a system generated property.

trans-unit.source: The resource ID (_rid) is a unique identifier that is also hierarchical per the resource stack on the resource model.
trans-unit.target: The resource ID (_rid) is a unique identifier that is also hierarchical per the resource stack on the resource model.

trans-unit.source: It is used internally for placement and navigation of the attachment resource.
trans-unit.target: It is used internally for placement and navigation of the attachment resource.

trans-unit.target: _ts

trans-unit.target: This is a system generated property.

trans-unit.source: It specifies the last updated timestamp of the resource.
trans-unit.target: It specifies the last updated timestamp of the resource.

trans-unit.source: The value is a timestamp.
trans-unit.target: The value is a timestamp.

trans-unit.target: _self

trans-unit.target: This is a system generated property.

trans-unit.source: It is the unique addressable URI for the resource.
trans-unit.target: It is the unique addressable URI for the resource.

trans-unit.target: _etag

trans-unit.source: This is a system generated property that specifies the resource etag required for optimistic concurrency control.

trans-unit.target: Check for missing curly brackets or quotes.

trans-unit.source: Response Example
trans-unit.target: Response Example

trans-unit.source: Sample Response: Attachment with Raw Media
trans-unit.target: Sample Response: Attachment with Raw Media

trans-unit.source: Note that the <legacyBold>media</legacyBold> property indicates the media link where the raw media can be retrieved from the DocumentDB attachment storage.
trans-unit.target: Note that the <legacyBold>media</legacyBold> property indicates the media link where the raw media can be retrieved from the DocumentDB attachment storage.

trans-unit.source: The <legacyBold>Slug</legacyBold> value is recorded in the <legacyBold>id</legacyBold> property while the <legacyBold>Content-Type</legacyBold> value is recorded in the <legacyBold>contentType</legacyBold> property.
trans-unit.target: The <legacyBold>Slug</legacyBold> value is recorded in the <legacyBold>id</legacyBold> property while the <legacyBold>Content-Type</legacyBold> value is recorded in the <legacyBold>contentType</legacyBold> property.

trans-unit.source: Sample Response: Attachment without Raw Media
trans-unit.target: Sample Response: Attachment without Raw Media

trans-unit.source: The response is similar to the POST request for the raw media attachment aside from the fact that the media is stored somewhere else.
trans-unit.target: The response is similar to the POST request for the raw media attachment aside from the fact that the media is stored somewhere else.

trans-unit.source: Note that in this case, the brush.png file is stored at www.bing.com.
trans-unit.target: Note that in this case, the brush.png file is stored at www.bing.com.
